item.title: 以下是美国 6 月份 CPI 报告的主要内容
item.description: 以下是周四公布的 6 月份美国消费者价格指数报告的主要内容：【原文：Here are the key takeaways from the June US consumer price index report released Thursday:】

item.title: 华尔街黑盒子 ETF 在 1,360 亿美元主动型基金热潮中被冷落
item.description: 它们被誉为美国 ETF 行业的游戏规则改变者，有望重振华尔街经理们的选股艺术，因为他们担心自己的策略会被模仿者效仿。【原文：They were pitched as game-changers for the US ETF industry, promising to revive the art of stock picking for Wall Street managers worried their strategies would be aped by copycats.】

item.title: 美国通胀后日元对美元升值 2
item.description: 在美国通胀率低于预期的情况下，日元对美元的升幅扩大到 2%。【原文：The yen extended an advance against the dollar to 2% in the wake of a softer-than-expected print of US inflation.】

item.title: 阿尔凯戈斯不可能重演，对吗？
item.description:
银行可以从其剩余的黄金经纪业务中获得一些安慰。【原文：

Banks can take some comfort in the rest of their prime-brokerage business.

】

item.title: 摩根大通称美股创新高令套期保值困难重重
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The artificial intelligence rally is driving stocks to fresh all-time highs, and hedging those gains requires greater creativity, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 中国为何要遏制卖空股票？
item.description: 随着中国股市的复苏开始陷入停滞，政府宣布了一些迄今为止最严厉的措施来遏制卖空行为，以支持市场。【原文：With a recovery in Chinese shares beginning to sputter, the government has announced some of the most stringent measures yet to curb the practice of short selling in an effort to support the market.】

item.title: 巴里-卡莱包（Barry Callebaut）因可可价格下跌导致巧克力需求受压而下滑
item.description: 巴里-卡乐堡公司（Barry Callebaut AG）的股价创下了自2015年以来的最大跌幅，原因是投资者怀疑巧克力需求能否承受住高涨的可可价格。【原文：Barry Callebaut AG’s shares plunged the most since 2015 as investors doubted whether chocolate demand would withstand sky-high cocoa prices.】

item.title: 亚马逊受到英国食品杂货供应监督机构的调查威胁
item.description: 据英国食品杂货监管机构称，如果亚马逊公司不改善其对供应商的待遇，可能会在英国面临正式调查。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. could face a formal investigation in the UK if it does not improve its treatment of suppliers, according to the country’s grocery regulator.】

item.title: 特斯拉 11 天连胜引发估值现实检验
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Tesla Inc. shares are climbing at a frenetic pace, but it’s becoming harder to argue the case for the bulls.】

item.title: 贝恩和 Reverence 接近以 35 亿美元收购 Envestnet
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝恩资本和 Reverence Capital Partners 即将达成一项约 35 亿美元的交易，将财富管理软件供应商 Envestnet 公司私有化。【原文：Bain Capital and Reverence Capital Partners are close to agreeing a roughly $3.5 billion deal to take Envestnet Inc., a provider of wealth-management software, private, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 欧佩克看涨石油需求的观点与现实不符
item.description:
另外两家主要机构的预测显示，消费增长将更加疲软。【原文：

Forecasts from two other key agencies show much weaker consumption growth.

】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行调整领导层，将 P&C 银行部门一分为二
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行正在调整其领导层，并将其最大的部门一分为二，这是戴夫-麦凯（Dave McKay）担任首席执行官十年来最大规模的重组之一。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada is shuffling its leadership ranks and breaking its largest division into two, in one of the biggest reorganizations of Dave McKay’s decade-long tenure as chief executive officer.】

item.title: 尼日利亚丹格特大型炼油厂加大美国原油进口量
item.description: 尼日利亚新建的丹格特（Dangote）大型炼油厂正在吸纳越来越多的美国原油，将这些原油桶运过数千英里的大西洋。【原文：Nigeria’s new Dangote mega-refinery is lapping up ever more US crude, bringing the barrels thousands of miles across the Atlantic ocean.】

item.title: 前 "爱情岛 "明星为推广外汇交易计划认罪
item.description: 一群电视真人秀明星和社交媒体影响者被指控向数百万 Instagram 追随者推销未经授权的外汇交易产品，他们对此不认罪。【原文：A group of reality TV stars and social media influencers pleaded not guilty to accusations that they promoted an unauthorized foreign exchange trading product to millions of Instagram followers.】

item.title: 欧洲债券销售迎来夏季前的最后一波高潮
item.description: 随着动荡的法国大选后市场情绪的恢复，以及借款人赶在夏季假期前完成交易，欧洲新债券销售市场将迎来自 5 月底以来最繁忙的一周。【原文：Europe’s market for new bond sales is headed for its busiest week since late May as sentiment recovers after the turbulent French elections and borrowers rush to get deals done before the region’s summer holidays.】

item.title: 债务期限临近，Petrofac 重组谈判陷入僵局
item.description: 英国能源服务公司 Petrofac Ltd 与债权人达成债务协议的时间不多了，此前几个月的谈判未能达成最终协议。【原文：UK energy services company Petrofac Ltd is running out of time to agree a debt deal with creditors, after months of talks have failed to produce a definitive agreement.】

item.title: 英国贷款机构警惕抵押贷款违约再次增加
item.description: 由于借贷成本居高不下，房主被迫进行再融资，英国银行正准备应对抵押贷款违约率的再次飙升。【原文：UK banks are bracing for another jump in default rates on mortgages as home owners are forced to refinance at borrowing costs that remain stubbornly high.】

item.title: 智利为 5.52 亿美元的商业地产洪流做好准备
item.description: 随着智利最大的两家房地产投资基金临近清算，智利的投资者正准备迎接罕见的商业楼宇涌入市场。【原文：Investors in Chile are bracing for a rare flood of commercial buildings to hit the market as two of the nation’s largest real estate investment funds near liquidation.】

item.title: 巴克莱认为欧盟 ESG 基金新规带来 300 亿美元抛售风险
item.description: 根据巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）分析师的研究，在欧洲提供环境、社会和公司治理基金的资产管理公司，如果打算在新规定下保留这一标签，可能需要卸载近 300 亿美元的股票和债券。【原文：Asset managers offering ESG funds in Europe may need to offload close to $30 billion in stocks and bonds if they intend to hold onto the label under new rules, according to research by analysts at Barclays Plc.】

item.title: 印度央行行长称现在降息为时尚早
item.description: 印度央行行长达斯（Shaktikanta Das）表示，印度的通胀率仍高于央行的目标，现在讨论降息还为时过早。【原文：India’s inflation remains above the central bank’s target and it’s premature to discuss interest rate cuts yet, Governor Shaktikanta Das said.】

item.title: 南非天然气用户计划在 2026 年前确保天然气供应
item.description: 在唯一的天然气供应商表示将于 2026 年停止天然气供应之后，南非的工业天然气用户正计划成立一家公司，以确保天然气供应。【原文：South Africa’s industrial gas users are planning to form a company that will ensure supply after the sole provider of the fuel said it will halt the flow in 2026.】

item.title: 私募基金的创意奇才正在掩盖危险信号
item.description:
由于利率居高不下，收购公司正试图通过各种财务手段来维持运营。投资者希望他们改善公司。【原文：

As interest rates stay high, buyout firms are trying all sorts of financial wheezes to keep things going. Investors want them to improve their companies instead.

】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。交易员们为期待已久的美国通胀数据做好准备，大科技公司在人工智能领域的挥霍令投资者担忧，乔-拜登总统面临更多压力。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Traders brace for much-awaited US inflation data, Big Tech’s AI splurge worries investors and President Joe Biden faces more pressure. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Kristine Aquino】

item.title: 毛里求斯中央银行随时准备干预外汇市场
item.description: 毛里求斯中央银行行长表示，在卢比兑美元汇率跌至历史新低后，该机构随时准备干预外汇市场。【原文：Mauritius’s central bank governor said the institution stands ready to intervene in the foreign currency market after the rupee slipped to a new record low against the dollar.】

item.title: 法国必须每年筹集 150 亿欧元以满足欧盟财政需求
item.description: 据知情人士称，法国下届政府将需要每年找到超过 150 亿欧元（162 亿美元）的额外收入或节余，以满足欧盟的要求。【原文：France’s next government will need to find more than €15 billion ($16.2 billion) in extra revenue or savings a year to meet European Union demands, according to people with knowledge of the assessment.】

item.title: 英国是欧洲并购的温床，目标包括 Currys 和 Deliveroo
item.description: 今年下半年，随着交易商在全球最便宜的股票市场之一寻找目标，英国将迎来又一波并购浪潮。【原文：The UK is set to see another wave of mergers and acquisitions in the second-half of the year as dealmakers hunt for targets in one of the world’s cheapest equity markets.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚连续第二个月降息，通胀率保持在目标范围内
item.description: 塞尔维亚央行在数月内第二次降息，在巴尔干国家通胀持续走低的情况下继续放宽政策。【原文：Serbia’s central bank delivered its second interest-rate cut in as many months, following through with easing as inflation in the Balkan nation continues to ebb.】

item.title: 法国政府准备削减开支以安抚市场
item.description: 法国财政部长布鲁诺-勒梅尔（Bruno Le Maire）正在推进削减开支的计划，尽管下届政府的政治前景并不明朗，但他仍试图向市场和欧盟保证法国的财政信誉。【原文：French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire is pressing ahead with planned spending cuts as he seeks to reassure markets and the European Union of the country’s fiscal credibility despite the political uncertainty over the next government.】

item.title: 参议院考虑拜登的联邦存款保险公司总裁人选，银行面临老对手
item.description: 2008 年金融危机后，克里斯蒂-戈德史密斯-罗梅罗作为美国政府银行救助计划的最高监督者，对欺诈或滥用公共资金的银行家采取了强硬的态度。【原文：As the top watchdog for the US government’s bank bailout program after the 2008 financial crisis, Christy Goldsmith Romero took a tough stance against bankers who committed fraud or abused public funds.】

item.title: 法国寻求一位能在总理职位上生存下来的人：看点
item.description: 对于一个更习惯于由总统领导其政府在议会中获得多数票以通过法律的国家来说，法国的临时立法选举造成了一种异常令人困惑的局面。【原文：France’s snap legislative election has caused an unusually perplexing situation for a country more used to having a president whose government commands a majority in parliament to pass laws.】
